text: Taliban have previously carried out
similar attacks at air bases naval air
bases there was one in Karachi three
years ago so it's not surprising that
they would admit responsibility
they've been upset with the government
in Pakistan because there were
indications that there might be some
kind of peace talks in the last few
months but they didn't get anywhere and
the Taliban said the army has continued
its operations in tribal areas and now
we will retaliate
they've been warning retaliation for
some time now so it's not surprising
that they would accept claim for this
audacious attack Karachi Airport also
reports I know you've been following
this shaza some gunman may still be on
the loose and rescue teams rushing back
to the site that's right this has
emerged in the last hour or so there are
reports of at least two fresh explosions
at that site and again television
pictures showing fire and smoke rising
from there
rescue teams have rushed back and and
reports suggest reinforcements are being
called and the biggest fear is that you
know some gunmen may still be on the
loose couple of hours ago we heard from
the spokesperson of the security force
that the operation was over they had
killed all 10 gunmen and they were now
securing the area and hoping to reopen
the airport in next six to eight hours
but things have taken a another twist
now and it looks like you know this is
not over yet
